gameFiles

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • gameFiles.GameEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GameEngine
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The main class to run the gameplay. This bridges the Window and the moveEngine.
    This is also where all obstacles are found and gameplay settings can be altered.
    The core structure of this class was a combination of Mike's code and Chua's code. Most of the code is written by Jason P'ng.
    Version:
    v4.0 June 12th, 2014
    Author:
    Jason P'ng, Mike aka Wilkystyles, Hock-Chuan Chua
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        The main constructor for the game engine. This initalizes the panel and adds necessary components.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initalizes the current layout to have basic objects required in every layout.
        This includes one ball, 3 walls, 2 slopes, and one paddle.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clears all arrays of objects. This is used to elminate previous layouts in order to apply a new one.

      • easyLayout

        public void easyLayout()
        Adds the objects for an easy layout setting.

      • mediumLayout

        public void mediumLayout()
        Adds the objects for an medium layout setting.

      • hardLayout

        public void hardLayout()
        Adds the objects for an hard layout setting.

      • setGameLayout

        public void setGameLayout(int layout)
        Sets the game layout. This clears the old one, initalizes the board, and adds objects for a new layout.
        switch statement distinguishes which layout should be applied.

      • getLayoutAsString

        public static java.lang.String getLayoutAsString()
        Returns a String manifestation of the current layout. This is used to the information panel.
        Switch statement distinguishes between layouts to return the appropriate String.
        Returns:
        a String representing the current layout.

      • setGameDifficulty

        public void setGameDifficulty(int difficulty)
        Sets the difficulty setting of the game. It can be easy, medium, or hard.
        This will determine from which set of questions the question panel will show.
        Switch statement determines how to set the difficulty according the parameter.
        Parameters:
        int - difficulty The difficulty setting to be applied.

      • getDifficultyAsString

        public static java.lang.String getDifficultyAsString()
        Returns a String manifestation of the current difficulty. This is used to the information panel.
        Switch statement distinguishes between difficulties to return the appropriate String.
        Returns:
        a String representing the current difficulty.

      • gamerun

        public void gamerun()
        This is the main methods that controls the game. The flow of the game will be interrupted if the ball falls in
        the gutter, if the user pauses the game, or the game is terminated.
        While (isRunning) - the game loop while the ball is moving
        if (terminated) - call to stop the game
        if (!paused && started) - If the game is paused or hasn't started the ball should not move.
        if (living.get(0).getY() > 590) - the ball is in the gutter at this point.
        if (timeLeftMillis < 5) - Ensure a minimum time is waited.
        Parameters:
        beginTimeMillis - - the time when the game loop starts
        timeTakenMillis - - the time for the loop to cycle through
        timeLeftMillis - - the time left over from the set amount of time according to the update rate.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overriden method to paint graphics on the panel. This includes painting of all objects and String on the game panel.
        for loops are used to traverse through each object array and paint all objects in them.
        if (isPaused()) - finds if the game is paused so \"game paused\" is painted on the game panel.
        if (isRunning == false) - determines if the ball is in the gutter so a red x is temporarily painted.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        Graphics - g graphics being used to paint the panel

      • allDead

        public static boolean allDead()
        Returns if there are no balls active in the game.
        Returns:
        if there is at least one ball active in the game.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns if the game has been paused.
        Returns:
        if whether or not the game is in a paused state.

      • setTerminated

        public void setTerminated(boolean state)
        Sets the terminated variable to end or revive the game.
        Parameters:
        boolean - state the state of termination the game is set to.

      • isTerminated

        public static boolean isTerminated()
        Returns the state of termination the game is in.
        Returns:
        whether or not the game has been terminated.

      • setStarted

        public void setStarted(boolean state)
        Sets if the game has started or not.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses the game if it is running. It will open a new pause window to display a pause menu.
        if (isRunning) - Checks if the game is running so the game isn't paused before it starts. if (open == false) - Checks if the pause window is already opened.

      • increaseScore

        public static void increaseScore(int increment)
        Increases the game score by the amount in the parameters.
        Parameters:
        int - increment the amounts the score is increased by.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Accessor method for the score of the game.
        Returns:
        the current score of the game.

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        Resets varables of the game to be played again.

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Method for the keylistener in the main window. This allows for pausing with 'p' and starting with space. It also
        extends to call the keyPressed method in the PseudoPaddle class to move it.
        Switch statement distinguished between different keys.
        For loop runs through all paddles to move all of them.
        Parameters:
        KeyEvent - e The key pressed to trigger this method to be called.
        int - key Represents the value of the key event to recognize which key was presssed.
